channel.title: Fixing number of players when logged out

item.title: Fixing number of players when logged out
item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

Okay. So add the int then add the messagetoall at the logout case?

Lol, I did it, but now it says, there are now -1 players or 0 players… when some1 logs out(With 2 players playing)

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing number of players when logged out
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Ohk then.
int playersOn = PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() - 1;
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+" has logged out. There are/is now " + playersOn + " players…";

item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Ok. Can you show me the Field declaration of playerCount?
Actually, replace that with;
public static int getPlayerCount() {
return playerCount - 1;
}

ayerHandler.getPlayerCount() - 1 + " players…";

item.title: Fixing number of players when logged out
item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

Hey, you know how if you add the

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+" has logged out. There are/is now " +PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ " players…";

To the logout case it starts saying when people log out irhgt? Well great… But then it tells us the number of player BEFORE the player logs out so it gets kinda awkward… So what I thought I would to is subtract 1 from the number of players there really is before they log out so it is right… So I tried doing

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+" has logged out. There are/is now " +PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()-1+ " players…";

But that doesn’t work… lol, I was just using my imagination… lol, any1 know the real way?

Read full topic
item.source: Fixing number of players when logged out
